M01.name: The Token
M01.description: The Primus wants bodies in the sand before the midday crowd thins. You're first on the slate — cheap entertainment for an indifferent house. Nobody expects much. Use that.

M02.name: Blood Contract
M02.description: A cloaked broker offers gold for a job with no name. The alley smells like a trap, the terms smell like a trap, and the broker's eyes move like a man who has done this before. Your debts don't care about any of that.

M03.name: Gladiator Debt
M03.description: A former champion sends word through a mutual contact. The favor is old — you didn't think he remembered it. He remembers everything. Fight or pay what you owe. There is no third option he's willing to discuss.

M04.name: The Lanista
M04.description: The Lanista doesn't summon people twice. She owns the arena, the contracts, the debts that keep fighters compliant — and she wants a conversation. She won't explain what about. She doesn't have to.

M05.name: The Shrine Fracture
M05.description: A wounded priest needs safe passage to the ridge shrine before whoever put three knife wounds in him finishes the job. The ridge road is Cult territory — they're watching for exactly this kind of errand. You'll be visible the entire way.

M06.name: The State's Eye
M06.description: Two State agents have been following you for four days. They're not subtle — they want you to know. That means they're either very confident or under orders to be visible. Either way, the decision is yours: run, talk, or make them regret the assignment.

M07.name: Underground Market
M07.description: Beneath the docks, in the part of Port City that doesn't appear on any official map, there's a market that operates on a different economy. Rare goods, rare debts, rare opportunities. The risks are priced accordingly.

M08.name: The Dread Pact
M08.description: The shadow faction doesn't announce itself. It presents a set of arrangements, a mutual understanding, an implied future where certain doors stay open. Accept their terms and certain things become possible that weren't before. What becomes impossible is something they'll explain later.

M09.name: Varro's Trial
M09.description: Varro tests things before he trusts them. The ambush on the ridge road is a test — one that could get you killed if you don't understand that in time. Survive it without hating him for it and you might have the most valuable ally in the city.

M10.name: The First Reckoning
M10.description: Every debt you've run up, every favor you've called in, every enemy you've made — they've all arrived at the same hour. This is what the point of no return actually feels like. Less dramatic than you expected. More final.

M11.name: The Arena Rises
M11.description: The Lanista opens the grand arena for the season's main program. Every rival with ambitions and every patron with influence has a seat. This is the bout that separates the fighters who are remembered from the ones who are replaced.

hazard.name: Blood on the Sand
hazard.summary: Arena sand is salted with shards; both sides take 1 true damage each round.

M12.name: Syndicate Notice
M12.description: The Syndicate doesn't threaten in words. They send two men to stand outside your door at noon and not leave until evening. The message is the men. Pay the tribute or become a different kind of lesson for the next person who doesn't.

M13.name: The Ridge Passage
M13.description: The ridge route has been blocked for three seasons by bandits with Cult connections. Everyone who needs it open has been waiting for someone else to pay the cost of opening it. You're the someone else.

M14.name: Varro's Offer
M14.description: Varro has been running a network of informants, sympathisers, and discreet creditors for longer than you've been fighting. He's willing to offer you access. Walk away and he remains neutral. Walk away wrong and he becomes something else.

M15.name: The Cult Demands
M15.description: The high priest of the shrine network arrives in person, which means the demand is significant enough that he didn't trust a messenger. Refuse and the Cult becomes an active obstacle. Comply and you inherit both their faith and their enemies.

M16.name: State Crackdown
M16.description: The State crackdown comes without warning, which means someone tipped them off and that someone knows your schedule. The district is locked down, the usual exits are watched. You have three options and none of them are clean.

M17.name: The Shadow War
M17.description: Two shadow factions have decided that the dock district is worth bleeding over. Their war has no regard for the people who live and work in it. You're in the middle by geography. Choosing a side means inheriting their enemies. Fighting both means inheriting everyone's.

M18.name: Debt Collectors
M18.description: Your creditors have run out of patience and hired the kind of men who don't negotiate. Pay the debt in full today — every coin, no extensions — or the negotiation happens differently. They've done this before. So have you.

M19.name: The Lanista's Gambit
M19.description: The Lanista has laid her entire position on this match — her contracts, her standing with the State, her ownership of the arena itself. She's not explaining why. She's asking you to win, and she's asking without the usual leverage, which means she's out of it. This is what trust looks like from her.

M20.name: End of Season One
M20.description: The season closes on a single bout that has taken three acts to arrive at. Everything that happened before was the prelude. The arena is full, the bets are placed, and the story is in its final chapter. What you do in the next hour will be what people say happened for the rest of their lives.

S01.name: The Rat Run
S01.description: A local thug has been borrowing from people who don't lend charitably. He's three payments behind and running out of explanations. Someone has to go collect, and that someone is apparently you. He won't be happy about it.

S14.name: Crowd Favorite
S14.description: An exhibition bout — no real stakes, just the crowd and the spectacle and the particular pleasure of a clean fight with no political weight attached. These moments don't last long. Enjoy the simplicity of it.

S02.name: The Lanista's Errand
S02.description: The Lanista has an errand that she can't assign to anyone on her official payroll. No questions, no written record, no witnesses who aren't already compromised. She's asked you specifically, which means she's either testing you or she's run out of people she trusts.

S06.name: The Pilgrim Guard
S06.description: A group of pilgrims needs safe passage to the ridge shrine. They're unarmed, they're slow, and the ridge road has been dangerous since the bandit factions moved in. Someone has to walk beside them, and they've asked in the name of their god, which is the kind of ask that costs you nothing to fulfill and everything to refuse.

S13.name: Shrine Debt
S13.description: The shrine priests have sent a formal request for protection — formal, because they understand that asking a fighter for help requires acknowledging that their faith isn't sufficient armor. They're right about that. You respect the honesty of it.
